com.cubeia.firebase.api.game.table
Interface TableListener

All Known Subinterfaces:
TournamentTableListener
All Known Implementing Classes:
TableListenerAdapter, TournamentTableListenerAdapter
public interface TableListener

Listen to table events. This interface is accessed by Firebase by one of two methods: 1) The game implements TableListenerProvider; or 2) the game implements TableListener directly. If the game implements both, the provider has precedence.

Author:
Fredrik

playerLeft

void playerLeft(Table table,
                int playerId)
A player has left the table. This method is called before the player is removed from any registry, and before the leave action is sent to the other players at the table.

Parameters:
table -
playerid -

playerStatusChanged

void playerStatusChanged(Table table,
                         int playerId,
                         PlayerStatus status)

A Player Status has changed.

This will typically occur when a player has disconnected without an explicit leave event (crashes, network failure etc).

If you implement a TableInterceptor that will deny players from leaving the table, then a status changed event will also be triggered.

Parameters:
playerId -
status -

seatReserved

void seatReserved(Table table,
                  GenericPlayer player)

A player has reserved a seat at the table.

The player will not receive any game events until he has joined the table by accepting the reservation. When a player accepts and joins the table you will receive a playerJoined notification as usual.

Parameters:
table -
player -
